intro: Humboltia spiralis, commonly known as the spiral cactus, is a unique species native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of spines, which gives it its common name. The plant has a short, thick stem that stores water, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and bloom in the spring. Humboltia spiralis is adapted to full sun and well-drained soil, making it a hardy plant for desert gardens.
